mdfeature package¶

Submodules¶

mdfeature.diffusionmap module¶

This module allows computation of the diffusionmaps. .. moduleauthor:: ZofiaTr

mdfeature.diffusionmap.compute_diffusionmaps(traj_orig, nrpoints=None, epsilon='bgh', nrneigh=64, weights=None, weight_params={})[source]¶

Compute diffusionmaps using pydiffmap.

Parameters:
  • traj_orig (mdtraj.Trajectory) – trajectory for diffusionmap analysis
  • nrpoints – if None, keep all trajectory, if integer, subsample the trajectory leaving nrpoints of datapoints.
  • epsilon – epsilon parameter in diffusionmap construction.
  • nrneigh (int) – number of neighbors in diffusionmap construction.
  • weights – weights for TMDmap. If None, no TMDmap but vanilla diffusionmap, if ‘compute’, weights will be computed using the energy and it requires the dictionary weight_params to be nonempty
Return type:

pydiffmap.diffusion_map.DiffusionMap, mdtraj.Trajectory
mdfeature.diffusionmap.compute_energy(xyz, simulation, positions_unit, energy_unit)[source]¶

Compute energy from the trajectory.

Parameters:
  • xyz (ndrarray) – trajectory
  • simulation (openmm.Simulation) – simulation object
  • positions_unit – simtk.unit of the positions
  • energy_unit – simtk.unit of the energy
Returns:

numpy ndarray of energy for every trajectory frame.
mdfeature.diffusionmap.compute_target_measure(energy, kT, energy_unit)[source]¶

Helper function to compute Boltzman density from energy and temperature.

Parameters:
  • energy (numpy.ndarray) – energy value, shape number of frames
  • kT (numpy.ndarray) – kT factor, computed as kT = openmmtools.constants.kB * simtk.unit.kelvin * temperature, where temperature is a double
mdfeature.diffusionmap.energy(state, simulation)[source]¶

Evaluate energy from the current state.

Parameters:
  • state (openmm.positions) – the current state
  • simulation (openmm.Simulation) – simulation object

mdfeature.features module¶

This module contains functions facilitating feature selection.

mdfeature.features.compute_all_correlations(traj, mydmap, dimension, list_of_functions, nevery=1, list_of_params=None, progress_bar=True)[source]¶

Calls features.correlations_features for first ‘dimension’ eigenvectors.

Parameters:
  • traj (mdtraj.Trajectory) – trajectory to evaluate the features from
  • mydmap (pydiffmap.diffusion_map.Diffusionmap) – diffusionmap object
  • list_of_functions – list of functions computing the features
  • nevery – subsample the trajectory and eigenvectors as x[::nevery]
  • dimension (int) – number of eigenvectors
  • dimension – number of diffusionmap eigenvectors
  • nevery – subsample the trajctory as traj[::nevery] to accelerate the correlation computations
Returns:

dict correlations with the dimension as keys for return of features.correlations_features
mdfeature.features.compute_correlation(v, cv, coeff='pearson', minmax=False)[source]¶

Correlation coefftients.

Parameters:
  • v (ndarray) – eigenvector size(n, 1)
  • cv (ndarray) – feature size(n, 1)
  • coeff (str) – pearson or spearmanr, see scipy.stats
  • minmax – renormalize the values to be in [0,1]
mdfeature.features.compute_cos_torsion_mdraj(traj, angle_index)[source]¶

Return cos of torsions.

mdfeature.features.compute_cv(X_FT, top, cv_indices_chosen)[source]¶
mdfeature.features.compute_free_energy(cv1, cv2, bins=40)[source]¶

Free energy in 2D.

mdfeature.features.compute_torsion(coordinates, i, j, k, l)[source]¶

Compute torsion angle defined by four atoms.

ARGUMENTS

coordinates (simtk.unit.Quantity wrapping numpy natoms x 3) - atomic coordinates i, j, k, l - four atoms defining torsion angle

NOTES

Algorithm of Swope and Ferguson [1] is used.

[1] Swope WC and Ferguson DM. Alternative expressions for energies and forces due to angle bending and torsional energy. J. Comput. Chem. 13:585, 1992.

mdfeature.features.compute_torsion_mdraj(traj, angle_index)[source]¶

Compute torsion angle defined by four atoms.

ARGUMENTS

traj (mdtraj trajectory frame) - atomic coordinates i, j, k, l - four atoms defining torsion angle

NOTES

Algorithm of Swope and Ferguson [1] is used.

[1] Swope WC and Ferguson DM. Alternative expressions for energies and forces due to angle bending and torsional energy. J. Comput. Chem. 13:585, 1992.

mdfeature.features.correlations_cv_torsion_index(evec, traj, list_of_indices)[source]¶

evec: diffmap eigenvector traj: trajectory (mdtraj) list_of_indices: list of indices to compute torsions from

mdfeature.features.correlations_features(evec, traj, list_of_functions, list_of_params=None, progress_bar=True)[source]¶

Compute correlations between the eigenvector and a list of functions evaluated on the trajectory, optionally with some parameters taken from list_of_params.

Parameters:
  • evec – diffmap eigenvector
  • traj – trajectory (mdtraj)
  • list_of_functions – list of functions
  • (optional) (list_of_params) – list of list_of_params. If None, then functions will be called without parameters. If list_of_params is list, then the length of list_of_functions must equal to list_of_params.
Returns:

numpy array of correlations of length of the function list.
mdfeature.features.create_torsions_list(atoms, size=None, print_list=True, append_to=None)[source]¶

Create list of indices for torsion angles.

Parameters:
  • atoms – if np.int - number of atoms to create the combinations from. If list of ints, combinations of these indeces will be generated.
  • size – number of randomly selected quadruples. If size is None, select all, if int, randomly choose int many combinations.
  • print_list (bool) – print the generated list.
  • append_to (list) – append to an existing list.
mdfeature.features.get_angle_name(phi_adapt, psi_adapt)[source]¶
mdfeature.features.get_index_combinations(all_combinations, index)[source]¶

assume unique

mdfeature.features.get_name(element_idx, table=None, pdb_file=None, format='full')[source]¶

Given index of one atom, return string of the element name in the required format

Parameters:
  • element_idx (int) – index of one element
  • table (optional) (dict) – table returned by table, bonds = mdtrajectory.topology.to_dataframe()
  • pdb_file (optional, required for table) (str) – string containing path to the topology file (pdb)
  • format (str) – format of the name string - ‘full’ default is resName + resSeq + element, ‘short’is resSeq + element
mdfeature.features.get_name_torsion(indices, table=None, pdb_file=None, format='full')[source]¶

Given indices of the atom, return string of atom names in the format resName + resSeq + element

Parameters:
  • indices (list) – list of ints indices of 4 atoms used for torsions
  • table (dict) – table returned by table, bonds = mdtrajectory.topology.to_dataframe()
  • pdb_file (str) – string containing path to the topology file (pdb)
  • format (str) – format of the name string - ‘full’ default is resName + resSeq + element, ‘short’is resSeq + element
mdfeature.features.identify_features(correlations, all_combinations, remove_nans=False)[source]¶

Choose two most correlated features.

Parameters:
  • correlations – returned by features.compute_all_correlations
  • all_combinations – parameters of the features (for example indices for the torsions)
  • remove_nans – search only non nans features
Returns:

features_indices - index of the best feature from the function list, correlations_features - the corresponding correlation, features_indices_2 - second best feature, correlations_features_2
mdfeature.features.identify_worst_features(corr, all_combinations, dimension)[source]¶

Least correlated features, see identify_features for input and output.
